title: An R Package to Obtain Time from WorldTimeAPI
text: get tibble valid timezone names run Requesting current time specific timezone can done function returns list class worldtimer. print console print formatted time string queried time like However, object with_tz includes additional information. can check full contents API returns current time microsecond precision R defaults printing decimal digits seconds. can changed setting options(digits.secs). (Please note option R specific rounding. just cuts digits.) Instead providing specific timezone, can also get time current public ip address ’s also possible provide specific ip address, e.g. following public ip DNS server Osaka, Japan
code: library(worldtimer) worldtimer_timezones() #> # A tibble: 386 × 1 #>    timezone            #>    <chr>               #>  1 Africa/Abidjan      #>  2 Africa/Accra        #>  3 Africa/Algiers      #>  4 Africa/Bissau       #>  5 Africa/Cairo        #>  6 Africa/Casablanca   #>  7 Africa/Ceuta        #>  8 Africa/El_Aaiun     #>  9 Africa/Johannesburg #> 10 Africa/Juba         #> # … with 376 more rows with_tz <- worldtimer("America/New_York") print(with_tz) #> [1] "2022-03-22 03:15:47 EDT" str(with_tz) #> List of 14 #>  $ abbreviation: chr "EDT" #>  $ datetime    : chr "2022-03-22T03:15:47.666543-04:00" #>  $ day_of_week : int 2 #>  $ day_of_year : int 81 #>  $ dst         : logi TRUE #>  $ dst_from    : chr "2022-03-13T07:00:00+00:00" #>  $ dst_offset  : int 3600 #>  $ dst_until   : chr "2022-11-06T06:00:00+00:00" #>  $ raw_offset  : int -18000 #>  $ timezone    : chr "America/New_York" #>  $ unixtime    : int 1647933347 #>  $ utc_datetime: POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-03-22 07:15:47" #>  $ utc_offset  : chr "-04:00" #>  $ week_number : int 12 #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "worldtimer" options(digits.secs = 3) print(with_tz) #> [1] "2022-03-22 03:15:47.666 EDT"  options(digits.secs = 6) print(with_tz) #> [1] "2022-03-22 03:15:47.666543 EDT" devs_ip <- worldtimer_ip() str(devs_ip) #> List of 14 #>  $ abbreviation: chr "CET" #>  $ datetime    : chr "2022-03-22T08:15:47.795926+01:00" #>  $ day_of_week : int 2 #>  $ day_of_year : int 81 #>  $ dst         : logi FALSE #>  $ dst_from    : NULL #>  $ dst_offset  : int 0 #>  $ dst_until   : NULL #>  $ raw_offset  : int 3600 #>  $ timezone    : chr "Europe/Berlin" #>  $ unixtime    : int 1647933347 #>  $ utc_datetime: POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-03-22 07:15:47.795926" #>  $ utc_offset  : chr "+01:00" #>  $ week_number : int 12 #>  -
